name: French in a Flash: Homemade Merguez Boulettes
description: Merguez is a fiery, spicy sausage from North Africa, commonly served in France as hot dogs are on the streets of Manhattan. These little meatballs are the perfect way to recreate the flavor at home, served with minty yogurt sauce to douse the fire.
recipeIngredient: The leaves from 2 sprigs mint, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, gently work all the flavorings into the lamb, without over-working the meat. Roll tablespoon-sized balls of the lamb, and place them on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Stick with pretty toothpicks, and serve with the creamy mint sauce (recipe follows).
Simply stir everything together. About as easy as it gets!
